sub_title: MScBA Alumna @ RSM | Marketing Specialist | Looking For New Opportunities in Marketing & Communications
summary:
I have a passion for seeking out impactful stories, empowering mindsets, and collaborating with change-makers. With a keen interest in marketing and communication, I am constantly drawn to the industry's dynamic and data-driven approach, as well as its boundless creativity.

Over the years, I have honed my skills and gained valuable experience through my work with a range of organizations, including NGOs, student-run venture capital fund, startup, and advertising agencies. My expertise spans strategic planning, inbound marketing, social media marketing, content marketing, community management, event management, copywriting, SEO fundamentals, analytics, and design.

My areas of interest include
➕ Strategy
➕ Strategic Communication
➕ Digital Marketing
➕ Impact-Driven Marketing
➕ Brand Management
➕ Project Management 
➕ Campaign and Content Development
➕ Social Media Marketing
➕ Inbound Marketing
➕ Account Management 
➕ Event organisation 
➕ Diversity, Equity & Inclusion 
➕ Sustainability, Sustainable Fashion

💡 I am driven, ambitious, and always on the lookout for exciting new opportunities to apply my knowledge and skills. If you are looking for a dedicated professional, I would love to hear from you. Please feel free to contact me at any time!

school.name: Rotterdam School of Management, Erasmus University

projects.title: Meet & Greet
projects.description:
Social isolation restricted us from meeting and connecting with people. As we are social animals, a meaningful connection is vital to us. That is the reason why Meet & Greet was brought to life. We wanted to develop an initiative where both students and employees can casually gather and connect with one another while abiding by the Covid regulations.

With this pivot project, we expect to create safe opportunities for students to make meaningful connections. We’ve arranged for standing coffee tables with conversational cards to help people get started with a conversation.

projects.title: European Youth Week, ''IDEA+'' Event
projects.description:
During the period from 1 to 7 May, a series of events were held across Europe to educate young people on various EU mobility opportunities, as well as their significant contributions to Europe's values like solidarity, inclusion, democracy, and active citizenship.

My role included:
•	Serving as the ambassador and primary organizer in Mazeikiai city.
•	Planning all aspects of the event, such as venue, sponsors, promotions, etc.
•	Developing a script for the event.
•	Managing and supervising the event team.

projects.title: Share “Become a Santa Claus”
projects.description:
During the Christmas season, I initiated a project with my fellow colleagues at Interact club to place large boxes in nearly every school and pre-school in Mazeikiai city. Our goal was to collect food and toys for the local animal shelter and establish a new tradition within the club. 

My role included:
•	Communicating with schools and pre-schools to obtain their cooperation
•	Coordinating with the animal shelter
•	Supervising the placement and collection of the boxes in each school

projects.title: Cozy Evening Concert
projects.description:
Cosy evening - is an acoustic concert for youth, which was held at the musical school of Mazeikiai. Youth could enjoy local artists' music, a free cup of tea and many home-made sweets. That year it brought over 200 young people for pleasurable memories. 

My role included: 
•	Organisation of the event, from venue to marketing matters
•	Supervision of the venue, artists
•	Promotion of the event
•	Creation of the evening programme

•	Directed mental health project Meet & Greet Street and organized the European UIF meet-up 
•	Coordinated social media accounts, designed posts and reels

My focus is on the University of Twente student experience and their well-being.
More about the projects I contributed can be found in the Impact Journal: https://issuu.com/uifellows/docs/uif_impact_journal_2021-2022_-_with_presets_new 

University Innovation Fellows, trained by Stanford's d.school, empower students around the world to become agents of change in higher education. Fellows create opportunities that help their peers unlock their creative potential and develop the design-centred mindset required to take on complex challenges in today’s world. Fellows are students of all majors and academic levels – from freshmen to PhDs – who want to shape the future of education.
profile_positions.title: Fellow

Ogilvy is one of the largest advertising agencies in the world. Started in 1948 by David Ogilvy, the father of advertising, with no clients and a staff of two, the agency has grown to 450 offices in 169 cities. Ogilvy is part of the WPP Group and provides a comprehensive range of marketing services, including advertising, PR, public affairs, branding, shopper marketing, healthcare communications, and digital marketing. The advertising giant is an agency of record for Nationwide, Motorola, KFC, Bacardi-Martini, Amazon and more.

For more information, visit http://www.ogilvy.com/
profile_positions.title: Strategy Intern

profile_positions.description:
•	Reactivated social media accounts: content planning & creation, data analytics, designing campaigns, and Facebook & Instagram ads.
	•	Increasing LinkedIn following by 300%, from ~300 to ~1200 followers; Instagram by 150% (both organically).
•	Managed PR, drafted press releases, and handled media communication during startup investments.
•	Upgraded WordPress and SEO: project – website update and blog and inbound marketing optimisation.
•	Coordinated a team of 5 brand ambassadors.
•	Strengthened the partnership with TechLeap and represented DSIF in the #FundRight (DE&I) movement.
•	Oversaw and managed the end-to-end recruitment process, including candidate sourcing, screening, interviewing, and selection.
•	Contributed to startup assessments, investment procedures and investment decision-making.

Dutch Student Investment Fund (DSIF) is a venture capital fund managed by students from the University of Twente and Saxion University of Applied Sciences. It was established in 2016 as the first student-run European venture capital fund. DSIF invests in innovative startups created by bachelor, master, PhD students or recent graduates and helps young student entrepreneurs to turn their great ideas into real startups.

The Council of Youth Affairs is a collegial advisory institution, functioning under the Department of Youth Affairs on social grounds, constituted on the basis of equal partnership from the representatives, delegated by the state institutions and the Lithuanian Youth Council. The Council of Youth Affairs includes 12 members: 6 representatives of the state institutions and 6 representatives of youth organizations.
